dismissalText.commentary: Charith Asalanka run out (†Rahmanullah Gurbaz) 91 (95b 12x4 0x6 156m) SR: 95.78

dismissalComment.html: Disaster for Sri Lanka! Kumara misses the drive as this goes to the keeper. They look to run the bye to the keeper to get Asalanka on strike, but Gurbaz throws down the striker's stumps. Asalanka is not even in the frame.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva b Mohammad Nabi 51 (59b 5x4 0x6 71m) SR: 86.44

dismissalComment.html: And Nabi strikes! A loose stroke from DDS sees Nabi rattle the stumps. This was just a plain straight delivery on off, on a length. Dhananjaya looks to sweep but gets nowhere near it as the ball crashes into off stump. The partnership is broken on 99.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken behind the stumps! Banged into the track outside off stump and this one, like countless deliveries before it, seems to just stick in the surface. Mathews tries to pull it away but is early into his stroke, only managing a feather that Gurbaz gobbles up!

headshotImage.caption: Dushan Hemantha
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushan Hemantha

dismissalComment.html: And Hemantha's cameo comes to an end! Full toss on off, but he only manages to slice this drive straight to mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Edged and gone! Dimuth's return to ODI cricket is not a fruitful one. This is a length ball just outside off, and Dimuth just has a nothing waft at this. Simple take at second slip.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gone this time! Soft dismissal. This is short and Mendis has pulled it straight into the grateful pouch of square leg. Ball stuck a bit in the surface and Mendis ended up being a bit early on the stroke. Toe ends this straight to Rahmat Shah.

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Pathum Nissanka c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 38 (59b 5x4 0x6 101m) SR: 64.4

dismissalComment.html: soft dismissal! Back of a length delivery on off stump that stops in the surface again. Nissanka opens up his stance, looking to pull it but like Mathews, is early into the stroke. The ball also seems to bounce a tad extra and spoons up off the top edge. Shahidi judges it, runs to his left from short mid wicket and completes a diving catch!

dismissalText.commentary: Dasun Shanaka b Noor Ahmad 17 (16b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: but Noor strikes straight back! This was the googly and it has Shanaka in a total tangle! Pitches on leg, and spins towards off. Shanaka looks to work this onside but is beaten all ends up as the top of off stump is disturbed. Big wicket for Afghanistan.

headshotImage.longCaption: Sadeera Samarawickrama player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c sub (S Samarawickrama) b Rajitha 98 (98b 11x4 2x6 131m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: holes out to deep backward square leg! Oh my! Banged into the track outside off stump. Ibrahim, looking to get to his hundred with a boundary, has a swipe at it. This one, though, just gets a little big on him and he cannot control it, splicing it straight to the sweeper on the deep backward square leg fence! He has missed out on a hundred but take nothing away from what was another wonderful innings!

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c de Silva b Pathirana 55 (80b 3x4 0x6 135m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: And Pathirana gets his maiden ODI wicket! This one was dug in short, 127kph, but it skidded on to Shah, who goes for the pull but only manages a top edge down to fine leg, who completes a good catch. Shah must go for a well played 55.

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Edged and gone! Shahidi must go after a strange passage of play. This was short of a length outside off, and Shahidi slashes at it. There's a noise as it goes through to the keeper, who doesn't appeal. While Rajitha too follows through without much celebration. There's vociferous appeal from a few surrounding fielders, and then eventually Rajitha turns back and appeals. At which point the umpire raises the finger.

headshotImage.caption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! Short and wide outside off stump. Gurbaz, after playing so many dot balls, feels the time is right to break free with this delivery. This one, though, just comes onto him a little slow, meaning that he is early into the stroke and can only drag it back onto his stumps! Massive, massive breakthrough!

commentTextItems.html: Short and wide, and cut to deep point for the winning single! Afghanistan win by 6 wickets!

commentPostTextItems.html: And that brings an end to our coverage. Tomorrow's a day off, but then we're back on Sunday for game two. Be sure to join us for that, but until then keep an eye out for Fidel's match report an analysis of today's game. Until then, on behalf of Shashwat, it's Madushka saying goodbye!

Afghanistan skipper Hashmatullah Shahidi: First of all I'm very happy about the performance of the team. I felt our recovery in the last overs was very good with the ball. Ibrahim Zadran is a match winner, and improving match by match, I want him to improve in the future as well."

Sri Lankan skipper Dasun Shanaka: "I think the plan was to play positive cricket, but four early wickets meant the top order didn't fire. It was a wicket where we could have set 300-plus. I think we could have also bowled better. Lahiru Kumara's injury also didn't help. For Pathirana coming straight from the IPL is not easy, especially to play a 50 over game. But this is the perfect game for him, so we will continue with him definitely. We need to win, but mainly we need to get ready for the qualifiers. We'll change the bowlers, but the batting line-up will stay the same."

Ibrahim Zadran is the Player of the Match for his 98 off 98, inclusive of 11 fours and 2 sixes: "It's really hard to get out like that [short of a hundred], but it's part of the game. To be honest, our bowlers bowled very well and executed the plans according to the conditions. They kept them below 300. 268 was a good score, but not that much. We wanted to get them around 250, but Rahmat Shah and I wanted to finish the game. I was middling the ball so well, so I told Rahmat I didn't want to stop my runs. I told him not to play any extra shots, play simple and rotate the strike."
Time now for the presentation ceremony...

6.20pm A comprehensive win for Afghanistan then, as they take a 1-0 lead in this three-match series! It was a victory setup by a classy run-a-ball 98 from Ibrahim Zadran, who was unfortunate to miss out on yet another ODI century. His 146-run second wicket stand with Rahmat Shah broke the chase open, and by the time he fell at the end of the 30th over, the required rate was at a very manageable five an over. Sri Lanka's bowlers toiled, but rarely managed to put pressure on the Afghan batters. In the field too Afghanistan showed discipline, and only really looked under the pump when Charith Asalanka (91) and Dhananjaya de Silva (51) were going strong. 268 was a challenging total, but Sri Lanka will know they missed an opportunity to put up an imposing one, losing wickets at crucial junctures. Game two is on Sunday, and the hosts have their work cut out for them.

commentTextItems.html: short, wide and put away! Cuts this high over backward point. Deep point puts in a dive but can't haul it in. Scores are level.

commentPreTextItems.html: Afghanistan now just one hit away

commentTextItems.html: full on off, driven square to deep point for one
Edged and four more! This was a good length outside off and induces the edge as Nabi looks to drive this. Third man can't get to it in time.
full outside off, pushed towards cover for a quick single
Up and over, and four! This was short and wide, and Nabi hops up and carves this high over backward point, one bounce over the ropes. Third man is too fine to get there.

commentPreTextItems.html: Qazi : "Good to see the temperament Factor with Trott there!"

commentTextItems.html: Edged and gone! Shahidi must go after a strange passage of play. This was short of a length outside off, and Shahidi slashes at it. There's a noise as it goes through to the keeper, who doesn't appeal. While Rajitha too follows through without much celebration. There's vociferous appeal from a few surrounding fielders, and then eventually Rajitha turns back and appeals. At which point the umpire raises the finger.
full toss on leg, but Nabi had made room to go inside out. Only manages to drive this straight back at DDS

Nissanka opens up his stance, looking to pull it but like Mathews, is early into the stroke. The ball also seems to bounce a tad extra and spoons up off the top edge. Shahidi judges it, runs to his left from short mid wicket and completes a diving catch!

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva b Mohammad Nabi 51 (59b 5x4 0x6 71m) SR: 86.44

dismissalComment.html: And Nabi strikes! A loose stroke from DDS sees Nabi rattle the stumps. This was just a plain straight delivery on off, on a length. Dhananjaya looks to sweep but gets nowhere near it as the ball crashes into off stump. The partnership is broken on 99.

dismissalText.commentary: Dasun Shanaka b Noor Ahmad 17 (16b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: but Noor strikes straight back! This was the googly and it has Shanaka in a total tangle! Pitches on leg, and spins towards off. Shanaka looks to work this onside but is beaten all ends up as the top of off stump is disturbed. Big wicket for Afghanistan.

dismissalText.commentary: Charith Asalanka run out (†Rahmanullah Gurbaz) 91 (95b 12x4 0x6 156m) SR: 95.78

dismissalComment.html: Disaster for Sri Lanka! Kumara misses the drive as this goes to the keeper. They look to run the bye to the keeper to get Asalanka on strike, but Gurbaz throws down the striker's stumps. Asalanka is not even in the frame.

headshotImage.longCaption: Lahiru Kumara player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Kumara 14 (23b 2x4 0x6 24m) SR: 60.86

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! Short and wide outside off stump. Gurbaz, after playing so many dot balls, feels the time is right to break free with this delivery. This one, though, just comes onto him a little slow, meaning that he is early into the stroke and can only drag it back onto his stumps! Massive, massive breakthrough!

dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c sub (S Samarawickrama) b Rajitha 98 (98b 11x4 2x6 131m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: holes out to deep backward square leg! Oh my! Banged into the track outside off stump. Ibrahim, looking to get to his hundred with a boundary, has a swipe at it. This one, though, just gets a little big on him and he cannot control it, splicing it straight to the sweeper on the deep backward square leg fence! He has missed out on a hundred but take nothing away from what was another wonderful innings!

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c de Silva b Pathirana 55 (80b 3x4 0x6 135m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: And Pathirana gets his maiden ODI wicket! This one was dug in short, 127kph, but it skidded on to Shah, who goes for the pull but only manages a top edge down to fine leg, who completes a good catch. Shah must go for a well played 55.

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c †Mendis b Rajitha 38 (47b 4x4 0x6 64m) SR: 80.85

dismissalComment.html: Edged and gone! Shahidi must go after a strange passage of play. This was short of a length outside off, and Shahidi slashes at it. There's a noise as it goes through to the keeper, who doesn't appeal. While Rajitha too follows through without much celebration. There's vociferous appeal from a few surrounding fielders, and then eventually Rajitha turns back and appeals. At which point the umpire raises the finger.
